post.description:
Trigger event is the main (and only) way to send notifications to subscribers. 
    The trigger identifier is used to match the particular workflow associated with it. 
    Additional information can be passed according the body interface below.

429.description: The client has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

503.description: The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overload or scheduled maintenance, which will likely be alleviated after some delay.

schema.example: Please wait some time, then try again.

Using this endpoint you can trigger multiple events at once, to avoid multiple calls to the API.

post.description:
Trigger a broadcast event to all existing subscribers, could be used to send announcements, etc.
      In the future could be used to trigger events to a subset of subscribers based on defined filters.

201.description: Broadcast request has been registered successfully

delete.description:
Using a previously generated transactionId during the event trigger,
     will cancel any active or pending workflows. This is useful to cancel active digests, delays etc...

429.description: The client has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

503.description: The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overload or scheduled maintenance, which will likely be alleviated after some delay.

schema.example: Please wait some time, then try again.

x-codeSamples.label: TypeScript
PHP
Go
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from novu_py import Novu
import os

with Novu(
    secret_key=os.getenv("NOVU_SECRET_KEY", ""),
) as novu:

    res = novu.cancel(transaction_id="<id>")

    # Handle response
    print(res)

parameters.name: templates
parameters.description: Array of template IDs or a single template ID

parameters.name: emails
parameters.description: Array of email addresses or a single email address

parameters.name: subscriberIds
parameters.description: Array of subscriber IDs or a single subscriber ID

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Date filter for records after this timestamp

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Date filter for records before this timestamp

put.description: Subscriber credentials associated to the delivery methods such as slack and push tokens.

429.description: The client has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

503.description: The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overload or scheduled maintenance, which will likely be alleviated after some delay.

x-codeSamples.label: TypeScript
PHP
Go
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
import novu_py
from novu_py import Novu
import os

with Novu(
    secret_key=os.getenv("NOVU_SECRET_KEY", ""),
) as novu:

    res = novu.subscribers.credentials.update(subscriber_id="<id>", update_subscriber_channel_request_dto={
        "provider_id": novu_py.UpdateSubscriberChannelRequestDtoProviderID.PUSHPAD,
        "credentials": {
            "webhook_url": "https://example.com/webhook",
            "channel": "general",
            "device_tokens": [
                "token1",
                "token2",
                "token3",
            ],
            "alert_uid": "12345-abcde",
            "title": "Critical Alert",
            "image_url": "https://example.com/image.png",
            "state": "resolved",
            "external_url": "https://example.com/details",
        },
    })

    # Handle response
    print(res)

import os

    res = novu.subscribers.credentials.append(subscriber_id="<id>", update_subscriber_channel_request_dto={

        "credentials": {
            "webhook_url": "https://example.com/webhook",

from novu_py import Novu
import os

with Novu(
    secret_key=os.getenv("NOVU_SECRET_KEY", ""),
) as novu:

    res = novu.subscribers.notifications.feed(request={
        "subscriber_id": "<id>",
        "payload": "btoa(JSON.stringify({ foo: 123 })) results in base64 encoded string like eyJmb28iOjEyM30=",
    })

    # Handle response
    print(res)

    secret_key=os.getenv("NOVU_SECRET_KEY", ""),
) as novu:

    res = novu.messages.delete_by_transaction_id(transaction_id="<id>")

    # Handle response
    print(res)

429.description: The client has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

503.description: The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overload or scheduled maintenance, which will likely be alleviated after some delay.

schema.example: Please wait some time, then try again.

info.title: Novu API
info.description: Novu REST API. Please see https://docs.novu.co/api-reference for more details.

tags.name: Events
tags.description: Events represent a change in state of a subscriber. They are used to trigger workflows, and enable you to send notifications to subscribers based on their actions.

tags.name: Subscribers
tags.description: A subscriber in Novu represents someone who should receive a message. A subscribers profile information contains important attributes about the subscriber that will be used in messages (name, email). The subscriber object can contain other key-value pairs that can be used to further personalize your messages.

tags.name: Topics
tags.description: Topics are a way to group subscribers together so that they can be notified of events at once. A topic is identified by a custom key. This can be helpful for things like sending out marketing emails or notifying users of new features. Topics can also be used to send notifications to the subscribers who have been grouped together based on their interests, location, activities and much more.

tags.name: Notification
tags.description: A notification conveys information from source to recipient, triggered by a workflow acting as a message blueprint. Notifications can be individual or bundled as digest for user-friendliness.

tags.name: Integrations
tags.description: With the help of the Integration Store, you can easily integrate your favorite delivery provider. During the runtime of the API, the Integrations Store is responsible for storing the configurations of all the providers.

tags.name: Layouts
tags.description: Novu allows the creation of layouts - a specific HTML design or structure to wrap content of email notifications. Layouts can be manipulated and assigned to new or existing workflows within the Novu platform, allowing users to create, manage, and assign these layouts to workflows, so they can be reused to structure the appearance of notifications sent through the platform.

tags.name: Workflows
tags.description: All notifications are sent via a workflow. Each workflow acts as a container for the logic and blueprint that are associated with a type of notification in your system.

tags.name: Notification Templates
tags.description: Deprecated. Use Workflows (/workflows) instead, which provide the same functionality under a new name.

tags.name: Workflow groups
tags.description: Workflow groups are used to organize workflows into logical groups.

tags.name: Changes
tags.description: Changes represent a change in state of an environment. They are analagous to a pending pull request in git, enabling you to test changes before they are applied to your environment and atomically apply them when you are ready.

tags.name: Environments
tags.description: Novu uses the concept of environments to ensure logical separation of your data and configuration. This means that subscribers, and preferences created in one environment are never accessible to another.

tags.name: Inbound Parse
tags.description: Inbound Webhook is a feature that allows processing of incoming emails for a domain or subdomain. The feature parses the contents of the email and POSTs the information to a specified URL in a multipart/form-data format.

tags.name: Feeds
tags.description: Novu provides a notification activity feed that monitors every outgoing message associated with its relevant metadata. This can be used to monitor activity and discover potential issues with a specific provider or a channel type.

tags.name: Tenants
tags.description: A tenant represents a group of users. As a developer, when your apps have organizations, they are referred to as tenants. Tenants in Novu provides the ability to tailor specific notification experiences to users of different groups or organizations.

tags.name: Messages
tags.description: A message in Novu represents a notification delivered to a recipient on a particular channel. Messages contain information about the request that triggered its delivery, a view of the data sent to the recipient, and a timeline of its lifecycle events. Learn more about messages.

tags.name: Organizations
tags.description: An organization serves as a separate entity within your Novu account. Each organization you create has its own separate integration store, workflows, subscribers, and API keys. This separation of resources allows you to manage multi-tenant environments and separate domains within a single account.

tags.name: Execution Details
tags.description: Execution details are used to track the execution of a workflow. They provided detailed information on the execution of a workflow, including the status of each step, the input and output of each step, and the overall status of the execution.

tags.name: Translations
tags.description: Translations are used to localize your messages for different languages and regions. Novu provides a way to create and manage translations for your messages. You can create translations for your messages in different languages and regions, and assign them to your subscribers based on their preferences.

secretKey.name: Authorization
secretKey.description: API key authentication. Allowed headers-- "Authorization: ApiKey <api_key>".

statusCode.description: HTTP status code of the error response.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the error occurred.

path.description: The path where the error occurred.

ctx.description: Optional context object for additional error details.

errorId.description:
Optional unique identifier for the error, useful for tracking using Sentry and 
      New Relic, only available for 500.

statusCode.description: HTTP status code of the error response.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the error occurred.

path.description: The path where the error occurred.

ctx.description: Optional context object for additional error details.

errorId.description:
Optional unique identifier for the error, useful for tracking using Sentry and 
      New Relic, only available for 500.

errors.description: A record of validation errors keyed by field name

messages: Must be a valid email address
Must be at least 18 years old

acknowledged.description: Indicates whether the trigger was acknowledged or not

error.description: In case of an error, this field will contain the error message(s)

transactionId.description: The returned transaction ID of the trigger

webhookUrl.description: The URL for the webhook associated with the channel.

deviceTokens.description: An array of device tokens for push notifications.

providerId.description: The ID of the chat or push provider.

integrationIdentifier.description: An optional identifier for the integration.

subscriberId.description: The internal identifier you used to create this subscriber, usually correlates to the id the user in your systems

email.description: The email address of the subscriber.

firstName.description: The first name of the subscriber.

lastName.description: The last name of the subscriber.

phone.description: The phone number of the subscriber.

avatar.description: An HTTP URL to the profile image of your subscriber.

data.description: An optional payload object that can contain any properties.

channels.description: An optional array of subscriber channels.

name.description: The trigger identifier of the workflow you wish to send. This identifier can be found on the workflow page.

payload.description:
The payload object is used to pass additional custom information that could be 
    used to render the workflow, or perform routing rules based on it. 
      This data will also be available when fetching the notifications feed from the API to display certain parts of the UI.

overrides.description: This could be used to override provider specific configurations

to.description: The recipients list of people who will receive the notification.

oneOf.description: Unique identifier of a subscriber in your systems
Unique identifier of a subscriber in your systems

transactionId.description: A unique identifier for this transaction, we will generate a UUID if not provided.

actor.description:
It is used to display the Avatar of the provided actor's subscriber id or actor object.
    If a new actor object is provided, we will create a new subscriber in our system

oneOf.description: Unique identifier of a subscriber in your systems

tenant.description:
It is used to specify a tenant context during trigger event.
    Existing tenants will be updated with the provided details.

oneOf.description: Unique identifier of a tenant in your system

name.description: The trigger identifier associated for the template you wish to send. This identifier can be found on the template page.

payload.description:
The payload object is used to pass additional information that 
    could be used to render the template, or perform routing rules based on it. 
      For In-App channel, payload data are also available in <Inbox />

overrides.description: This could be used to override provider specific configurations

transactionId.description: A unique identifier for this transaction, we will generated a UUID if not provided.

actor.description:
It is used to display the Avatar of the provided actor's subscriber id or actor object.
    If a new actor object is provided, we will create a new subscriber in our system

oneOf.description: Unique identifier of a subscriber in your systems

tenant.description:
It is used to specify a tenant context during trigger event.
    If a new tenant object is provided, we will create a new tenant.

oneOf.description: Unique identifier of a tenant in your system

ChannelTypeEnum.description: Channel type through which the message is sent

subscriberId.description: External unique identifier of the subscriber

_id.description: Internal to Novu unique identifier of the subscriber

atTime.description: Time at which the digest is triggered

weekDays.description: Days of the week for the digest

monthDays.description: Specific days of the month for the digest

events.description: Optional array of events associated with the digest, represented as key-value pairs

backoff.description: Regular digest: Indicates if backoff is enabled for the regular digest

updateMode.description: Regular digest: Indicates if the digest should update

_id.description: Unique identifier of the execution detail

createdAt.description: Creation time of the execution detail

isRetry.description: Whether the execution is a retry or not

isTest.description: Whether the execution is a test or not

active.description: Whether the step is active or not

_templateId.description: The identifier for the template associated with this step

_parentId.description: The unique identifier for the parent step

digest.description: Optional digest for the job, including metadata and events

updatedAt.description: Last updated time of the notification

hasMore.description: Indicates if there are more activities in the result set

_id.description: The unique identifier of the integration record in the database. This is automatically generated.

_environmentId.description: The unique identifier for the environment associated with this integration. This links to the Environment collection.

_organizationId.description: The unique identifier for the organization that owns this integration. This links to the Organization collection.

name.description: The name of the integration, which is used to identify it in the user interface.

identifier.description: A unique string identifier for the integration, often used for API calls or internal references.

providerId.description: The identifier for the provider of the integration (e.g., "mailgun", "twilio").

channel.description: The channel type for the integration, which defines how the integration communicates (e.g., email, SMS).

credentials.description: The credentials required for the integration to function, including API keys and other sensitive information.

active.description: Indicates whether the integration is currently active. An active integration will process events and messages.

deleted.description: Indicates whether the integration has been marked as deleted (soft delete).

deletedAt.description: The timestamp indicating when the integration was deleted. This is set when the integration is soft deleted.

deletedBy.description: The identifier of the user who performed the deletion of this integration. Useful for audit trails.

primary.description: Indicates whether this integration is marked as primary. A primary integration is often the default choice for processing.

conditions.description: An array of conditions associated with the integration that may influence its behavior or processing logic.

identifier.description: The unique identifier for the integration

_environmentId.description: The ID of the associated environment

providerId.description: The provider ID for the integration

channel.description: The channel type for the integration

active.description: If the integration is active, the validation on the credentials field will run

check.description: Flag to check the integration status

active.description: If the integration is active the validation on the credentials field will run

removeNovuBranding.description: If true, the Novu branding will be removed from the Inbox component

page.description: The current page of the paginated response

hasMore.description: Does the list have more items to fetch

pageSize.description: Number of items on each page

data.description: The list of items matching the query

webhookUrl.description: Webhook URL used by chat app integrations. The webhook should be obtained from the chat app provider.

channel.description: Channel specification for Mattermost chat notifications.

deviceTokens.description: Contains an array of the subscriber device tokens for a given provider. Used on Push integrations.

alertUid.description: Alert UID for Grafana on-call webhook payload.

title.description: Title to be used with Grafana on-call webhook.

imageUrl.description: Image URL property for Grafana on-call webhook.

state.description: State property for Grafana on-call webhook.

externalUrl.description: Link to upstream details property for Grafana on-call webhook.

providerId.description: The provider identifier for the credentials

credentials.description: Credentials payload for the specified provider

_integrationId.description: The unique identifier of the integration associated with this channel.

_id.description: The internal ID generated by Novu for your subscriber. This ID does not match the `subscriberId` used in your queries. Refer to `subscriberId` for that identifier.

firstName.description: The first name of the subscriber.

lastName.description: The last name of the subscriber.

email.description: The email address of the subscriber.

phone.description: The phone number of the subscriber.

avatar.description: The URL of the subscriber's avatar image.

locale.description: The locale setting of the subscriber, indicating their preferred language or region.

subscriberId.description: The identifier used to create this subscriber, which typically corresponds to the user ID in your system.

channels.description: An array of channel settings associated with the subscriber.

topics.description: An array of topics that the subscriber is subscribed to.

isOnline.description: Indicates whether the subscriber is currently online.

lastOnlineAt.description: The timestamp indicating when the subscriber was last online, in ISO 8601 format.

previous.description: The cursor for the previous page of results, or null if this is the first page.

Content-Type.description: The MIME type of the response body.

RateLimit-Limit.description: The number of requests that the client is permitted to make per second. The actual maximum may differ when burst is enabled.

RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests remaining until the next window.

RateLimit-Reset.description: The remaining seconds until a request of the same cost will be refreshed.

RateLimit-Policy.description: The rate limit policy that was used to evaluate the request.

Retry-After.description: The number of seconds after which the client may retry the request that was previously rejected.

Idempotency-Key.description: The idempotency key used to evaluate the request.

Idempotency-Replay.description: Whether the request was a replay of a previous request.
